alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 3:13AM MST until January 04 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. West winds gusting to 45 mph are expected over Marias Pass Monday afternoon and evening. * WHERE...Bad Rock Canyon, Essex, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Marias Pass, and Polebridge. * WHEN...From 11 AM Monday to 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be affected. Cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. Blowing snow may reduce visibility over Marias Pass.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
